etymologies: late 16th century. From Spanish (now hist.) tomín unit of weight for precious metals, any of various small silver coins from an unattested (perhaps spoken) Arabic form *ṯumin, variant (with epenthetic vowel) of Arabic ṯumn eighth part from ṯamāniya eight

definitions: In Spain and Spanish America: any of various small silver coins and monetary units, especially one equivalent in value to the real.
In Spain and Spanish America: a unit of weight for (especially precious) metals, generally equivalent to 12 grains in the local system of measurement (typically approx. 0.6 g).
